title: Aen 4 60-63 - SS sight - line 2 - Gram - genitive

content.description:
Queen Dido in Carthage

Ipsa tenens dextra paterampatera, -ae, f.: saucer pulcherrima Dido 
candentiscandens, -ntis, adj. = candidus, -a, -um vaccaevacca, -ae, f.: cow media inter cornua funditfundo, -ere = effundo, -ere 
aut ante ora deumdeum = deorum pinguespinguis, -e, adj.: fat spatiaturspatior, -ari = ambulo, -are ad aras 
instauratinstauro, -are: to renewque diem donis.
content.question: In line 2, cadentis vaccae is translated

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
